org.mixare
Class Marker

java.lang.Object
  org.mixare.Marker
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Marker>
Direct Known Subclasses:
IconMarker
public class Marker
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Marker>

This class will represent a physical location and will calculate it's visibility and draw it's text and visual representation accordingly. This should be extended if you want to change the way a Marker is viewed.

Author:
Justin Wetherell

Method Detail

set

public void set(java.lang.String name,
                double latitude,
                double longitude,
                double altitude,
                int color,
                java.lang.String reference)
Set the objects parameters. This should be used instead of creating new objects.

Parameters:
name - String representing the Marker.
latitude - Latitude of the Marker in decimal format (example 39.931269).
longitude - Longitude of the Marker in decimal format (example -75.051261).
altitude - Altitude of the Marker in meters (>0 is above sea level).
color - Color of the Marker.

handleClick

public boolean handleClick(float x,
                           float y)
Tell if the x/y position is on this marker (if the marker is visible)

Parameters:
x - float x value.
y - float y value.
Returns:
True if Marker is visible and x/y is on the marker.
